result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaylee A Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaylee A Johnson

2:37 PM Defendant Kaylee A Johnson in court.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Kaylee A Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$150 fine+ Court Costs+ DNA surcharge + DAA surcharge, payment plan $50/month beginning: December 1, 2022. 

***Case is eligible for expungement after all financial obligations have been satisfied.
Racine County Alternatives Program - Progress Report.

9:23 AM Defendant Kaylee A Johnson in court.  Attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski in court for Kaylee A Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense indicates they do not have an offer and that the defendant needs more time to complete classes. 
State puts offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over for COP.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No violent contact with the victim W.F (person, property, residence or family).

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kaylee A Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Kaylee A Johnson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
